definition: An electronic check that verifies patient's active insurance coverage and benefits before services are provided.
example_usage: Front desk staff run RTE before scheduling.

definition: A fixed amount a patient pays for a healthcare service usually at the time of visit.
example_usage: Patient paid a $20 co-pay at check-in.

definition: The amount a patient must pay for covered services before insurance begins to pay.
example_usage: The patient has a $1500 deductible to meet.

definition: The percentage of costs the patient pays after meeting the deductible.
example_usage: Patient responsible for 20% coinsurance.

definition: A statement from insurance showing what was covered and what the patient owes.
example_usage: Review the EOB to understand claim payment.

definition: The maximum amount a patient pays during a policy period before insurance covers 100%.
example_usage: Patient has reached their $5000 OOP maximum.

definition: Insurance approval required before certain services or medications can be provided.
example_usage: MRI requires prior auth before scheduling.

definition: A type of health insurance plan that offers flexibility to see any provider with lower costs for in-network.
example_usage: Patient has a PPO plan and can self-refer.

definition: A type of health insurance that requires members to use in-network providers and get referrals.
example_usage: HMO patients need a referral to see specialists.

definition: A health insurance plan that combines features of HMO and PPO plans.
example_usage: POS plan requires PCP coordination but allows out-of-network.

definition: Federal health insurance program primarily for people 65 and older.
example_usage: Patient is eligible for Medicare Part B.

definition: State and federal program providing health coverage for low-income individuals.
example_usage: Patient has Medicaid coverage for the visit.

definition: The amount paid for an insurance policy typically monthly.
example_usage: Monthly premium is $450 for family coverage.

definition: Medical services and procedures that an insurance plan will pay for.
example_usage: Annual physical is a covered service.

definition: Services or treatments that are not covered by an insurance policy.
example_usage: Cosmetic procedures are plan exclusions.

definition: Healthcare providers who have contracted with an insurance company to provide services at reduced rates.
example_usage: Using in-network providers saves money.

definition: Healthcare providers who have not contracted with an insurance company.
example_usage: Out-of-network services have higher patient costs.

definition: The maximum amount an insurance company will pay for a covered service.
example_usage: The allowable amount for the visit was $150.

definition: A request for payment submitted to an insurance company for services rendered.
example_usage: Submit the claim within 30 days of service.

definition: An insurance claim that has been rejected and will not be paid.
example_usage: The claim was denied due to missing information.

definition: A chronological description of the development of the patient's present illness.
example_usage: The HPI documents onset duration and character of symptoms.

definition: A systematic approach to collecting information about patient symptoms across body systems.
example_usage: Complete ROS includes all 14 organ systems.

definition: The process of evaluating the patient through observation palpation and other techniques.
example_usage: PE revealed normal heart and lung sounds.

definition: The identification of a disease or condition based on signs and symptoms.
example_usage: Primary Dx is type 2 diabetes mellitus.

definition: Medical care provided to a patient for a condition or disease.
example_usage: Tx includes lifestyle modifications and metformin.

definition: A single interaction between a patient and healthcare provider for assessment or treatment.
example_usage: Document the encounter in the EHR.

definition: A series of encounters related to the same condition within a specific timeframe.
example_usage: The pneumonia episode included 3 office visits.

definition: A method of documentation that organizes clinical information into four sections.
example_usage: Use SOAP format for progress notes.

definition: The primary reason the patient is seeking medical care.
example_usage: CC is chest pain for 2 hours.

definition: A record of all previous illnesses surgeries and medical conditions.
example_usage: PMH includes hypertension and GERD.

definition: A list of all previous surgical procedures the patient has undergone.
example_usage: PSH includes appendectomy in 2010.

definition: Information about diseases and conditions that run in the patient's family.
example_usage: FH significant for heart disease and diabetes.

definition: Information about the patient's lifestyle including smoking alcohol and occupation.
example_usage: SH reveals 20 pack-year smoking history.

definition: A record of substances that cause adverse reactions in the patient.
example_usage: Allergies include penicillin and shellfish.

definition: A current list of all medications the patient is taking.
example_usage: Medication list updated at every visit.

definition: Measurements of basic body functions including temperature pulse respiration and blood pressure.
example_usage: Vital signs stable within normal limits.

definition: Documentation of patient status and plan during an ongoing episode of care.
example_usage: Progress note shows improvement in symptoms.

definition: A report prepared when a patient leaves the hospital summarizing the stay and follow-up.
example_usage: Discharge summary sent to PCP.

definition: A comprehensive initial evaluation including patient history and physical examination.
example_usage: Complete H&P documented on admission.

definition: The clinician's interpretation and conclusion about the patient's condition.
example_usage: Impression is acute bronchitis.

definition: The treatment strategy and follow-up plans for the patient's condition.
example_usage: Plan of care includes antibiotics and recheck in 3 days.

definition: Instructions for medications tests or treatments written by the provider.
example_usage: Orders include CBC and basic metabolic panel.

definition: A blood test that measures different components of blood including RBCs WBCs platelets hemoglobin and hematocrit.
example_usage: Order CBC to evaluate for anemia.

definition: Measures the number of white blood cells which fight infection.
example_usage: Elevated WBC suggests infection.

definition: Measures the number of red blood cells which carry oxygen.
example_usage: Low RBC indicates anemia.

definition: A protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen throughout the body.
example_usage: Hemoglobin is 10.2 indicating anemia.

definition: The percentage of blood volume occupied by red blood cells.
example_usage: Hematocrit of 32% is below normal.

definition: Measures the number of platelets which help blood clot.
example_usage: Low platelet count increases bleeding risk.

definition: Measures the average size of red blood cells.
example_usage: High MCV suggests B12 or folate deficiency.

definition: Measures the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell.
example_usage: MCH helps classify type of anemia.

definition: Measures the average concentration of hemoglobin in red blood cells.
example_usage: MCHC elevated in hereditary spherocytosis.

definition: Measures variation in red blood cell size.
example_usage: Elevated RDW indicates mixed anemia types.

definition: A breakdown of the types of white blood cells present.
example_usage: Differential shows neutrophilia.

definition: A type of white blood cell that fights bacterial infections.
example_usage: Elevated neutrophils indicate bacterial infection.

definition: White blood cells important for immune response especially viral infections.
example_usage: Elevated lymphocytes suggest viral infection.

definition: White blood cells that become macrophages and fight pathogens.
example_usage: Elevated monocytes in chronic inflammation.

definition: White blood cells involved in allergic reactions and parasitic infections.
example_usage: Elevated eosinophils suggest allergies or parasites.

definition: White blood cells involved in allergic and inflammatory responses.
example_usage: Elevated basophils are rare.

definition: A blood test measuring electrolytes kidney function and glucose.
example_usage: Order BMP to check kidney function.

definition: An electrolyte that helps maintain fluid balance and nerve function.
example_usage: Sodium level is 138 mEq/L.

definition: An electrolyte critical for heart and muscle function.
example_usage: Potassium is 4.2 mEq/L.

definition: An electrolyte that helps maintain fluid and acid-base balance.
example_usage: Chloride level is normal at 102 mEq/L.

definition: Measures bicarbonate and reflects acid-base status.
example_usage: CO2 of 24 indicates normal acid-base balance.

definition: Measures waste product filtered by kidneys indicating kidney function.
example_usage: Elevated BUN suggests kidney impairment.

definition: A waste product used to assess kidney function.
example_usage: Creatinine of 1.8 indicates decreased kidney function.

definition: Measures the amount of sugar in the blood.
example_usage: Fasting glucose is 110 mg/dL.

definition: An expanded blood test including BMP plus liver function tests and proteins.
example_usage: Order CMP for complete metabolic assessment.

definition: Measures all proteins in blood including albumin and globulin.
example_usage: Total protein helps assess nutrition and liver function.

definition: A protein made by the liver important for maintaining fluid balance.
example_usage: Low albumin indicates malnutrition or liver disease.

definition: A liver enzyme that indicates liver damage when elevated.
example_usage: AST of 85 suggests liver inflammation.

definition: A liver enzyme more specific to liver damage than AST.
example_usage: Elevated ALT indicates hepatocellular injury.

definition: An enzyme found in liver and bone elevated in cholestasis and bone disorders.
example_usage: Elevated ALP suggests biliary obstruction.

definition: A breakdown product of red blood cells elevated in liver disease or hemolysis.
example_usage: Elevated bilirubin causes jaundice.

definition: Conjugated bilirubin elevated in biliary obstruction.
example_usage: Direct bilirubin is elevated in cholestasis.

definition: Unconjugated bilirubin elevated in hemolysis.
example_usage: Indirect bilirubin elevated in hemolytic anemia.

definition: An electrolyte important for bone health nerve and muscle function.
example_usage: Calcium level is 9.5 mg/dL.

definition: A blood test measuring cholesterol and triglycerides to assess cardiovascular risk.
example_usage: Fasting lipid panel shows elevated LDL.

definition: Measures all cholesterol in blood including HDL and LDL.
example_usage: Total cholesterol is 220 mg/dL.

definition: Good cholesterol that helps remove other forms of cholesterol from bloodstream.
example_usage: HDL of 55 mg/dL is protective.

definition: Bad cholesterol that can build up in arteries increasing heart disease risk.
example_usage: LDL of 150 mg/dL is above target.

definition: A type of fat in blood elevated levels increase cardiovascular risk.
example_usage: Triglycerides are 180 mg/dL.

definition: A type of cholesterol that carries triglycerides in blood.
example_usage: VLDL is calculated from triglycerides.

definition: Measures average blood glucose over the past 2-3 months used to diagnose and monitor diabetes.
example_usage: HbA1c of 7.2% indicates suboptimal diabetes control.

definition: A group of tests measuring thyroid function including TSH T3 and T4.
example_usage: Thyroid panel ordered to evaluate hypothyroidism.

definition: A hormone that regulates thyroid function elevated in hypothyroidism.
example_usage: TSH of 8.5 indicates hypothyroidism.

definition: Active thyroid hormone important for metabolism.
example_usage: Free T3 helps assess thyroid function.

definition: Main hormone produced by thyroid gland.
example_usage: Free T4 measures unbound hormone.

definition: Unbound active thyroid hormone available to tissues.
example_usage: Free T3 is low in hypothyroidism.

definition: Unbound thyroid hormone not attached to proteins.
example_usage: Free T4 is the preferred thyroid function test.

definition: Tests measuring blood clotting function including PT PTT and INR.
example_usage: Coag panel ordered before surgery.

definition: Measures how long it takes blood to clot evaluates extrinsic clotting pathway.
example_usage: PT is 12.5 seconds within normal range.

definition: Standardized measure of PT used to monitor warfarin therapy.
example_usage: INR goal is 2-3 for atrial fibrillation.

definition: Measures intrinsic clotting pathway used to monitor heparin therapy.
example_usage: PTT is prolonged on heparin therapy.

definition: A fibrin degradation product elevated in blood clots.
example_usage: Elevated D-dimer suggests possible DVT or PE.

definition: A group of tests evaluating iron status including serum iron TIBC ferritin and transferrin.
example_usage: Iron studies ordered to evaluate anemia.

definition: Measures the amount of iron in blood.
example_usage: Low serum iron suggests iron deficiency.

definition: Measures blood's capacity to bind and transport iron.
example_usage: Elevated TIBC in iron deficiency anemia.

definition: A protein that stores iron reflects total body iron stores.
example_usage: Low ferritin confirms iron deficiency.

definition: A protein that transports iron in blood.
example_usage: Transferrin saturation helps diagnose iron disorders.

definition: A marker of inflammation in the body elevated in infections and inflammatory conditions.
example_usage: Elevated CRP indicates active inflammation.

definition: A nonspecific test measuring inflammation by how fast RBCs settle.
example_usage: Elevated ESR suggests inflammatory process.

definition: A cardiac enzyme released during heart muscle damage used to diagnose heart attack.
example_usage: Elevated troponin confirms myocardial infarction.

definition: A hormone released by heart ventricles elevated in heart failure.
example_usage: BNP of 450 indicates heart failure.

definition: A precursor to BNP more stable marker for heart failure.
example_usage: NT-proBNP is elevated in decompensated heart failure.

definition: A protein produced by prostate gland elevated in prostate cancer or enlargement.
example_usage: PSA screening in men over 50.

definition: A tumor marker elevated in colorectal and other cancers.
example_usage: CEA monitored in colon cancer patients.

definition: A tumor marker for pancreatic and gastrointestinal cancers.
example_usage: CA 19-9 elevated in pancreatic cancer.

definition: A tumor marker for ovarian cancer.
example_usage: CA-125 monitored in ovarian cancer treatment.

definition: A tumor marker for liver cancer and germ cell tumors.
example_usage: Elevated AFP suggests hepatocellular carcinoma.

definition: A test examining urine for signs of kidney disease infection or other conditions.
example_usage: UA shows bacteria and WBCs.

definition: A test to identify bacteria causing urinary tract infection.
example_usage: Urine culture grew E. coli sensitive to ciprofloxacin.

definition: A test to detect bacteria or fungi in bloodstream.
example_usage: Blood cultures drawn before starting antibiotics.

definition: A test to identify organisms causing respiratory infection.
example_usage: Sputum culture positive for Streptococcus pneumoniae.

definition: Calculated estimate of kidney function based on creatinine age and gender.
example_usage: eGFR of 55 indicates stage 3 chronic kidney disease.

definition: Small amounts of albumin in urine indicating early kidney damage.
example_usage: Microalbumin screen positive in diabetic patient.

definition: Measures vitamin D levels in blood.
example_usage: Vitamin D level is 22 indicating deficiency.

definition: Measures B12 levels important for nerve function and RBC production.
example_usage: Low B12 causes macrocytic anemia.

definition: Measures folic acid levels important for cell division and RBC production.
example_usage: Low folate causes megaloblastic anemia.

definition: An electrolyte important for muscle and nerve function.
example_usage: Magnesium level is 1.8 mEq/L.

definition: A mineral important for bone health and energy metabolism.
example_usage: Phosphorus level checked in kidney disease.

definition: A waste product elevated in gout and kidney stones.
example_usage: Elevated uric acid level triggers gout attack.

definition: A waste product metabolized by liver elevated in liver failure.
example_usage: Elevated ammonia causes hepatic encephalopathy.

definition: A byproduct of metabolism elevated in tissue hypoxia or shock.
example_usage: Elevated lactate indicates sepsis.

definition: An enzyme that digests carbohydrates elevated in pancreatitis.
example_usage: Amylase of 300 suggests acute pancreatitis.

definition: An enzyme that digests fats more specific for pancreatitis than amylase.
example_usage: Lipase elevated in pancreatic inflammation.

definition: An enzyme in muscle and heart tissue elevated in muscle damage.
example_usage: Elevated CK after intense exercise.

definition: A cardiac-specific enzyme elevated in heart attack.
example_usage: CK-MB elevation confirms myocardial damage.

definition: An enzyme found in many tissues elevated in hemolysis liver disease and MI.
example_usage: LDH elevated in hemolytic anemia.

definition: A hormone produced by adrenal glands involved in stress response.
example_usage: Morning cortisol low in adrenal insufficiency.

definition: A pituitary hormone that stimulates cortisol production.
example_usage: ACTH stimulation test evaluates adrenal function.

definition: A hormone important for male sexual development and function.
example_usage: Low testosterone causes hypogonadism.

definition: A form of estrogen important for female reproductive function.
example_usage: Estradiol levels monitored in fertility treatment.

definition: A hormone important for menstrual cycle and pregnancy.
example_usage: Progesterone level confirms ovulation.

definition: A hormone that regulates reproductive processes.
example_usage: Elevated FSH indicates menopause.

definition: A hormone that triggers ovulation and regulates sex hormones.
example_usage: LH surge triggers ovulation.

definition: A hormone that stimulates milk production.
example_usage: Elevated prolactin causes galactorrhea.

definition: A hormone produced during pregnancy used in pregnancy tests.
example_usage: Positive hCG confirms pregnancy.

definition: Measures blood level of digoxin to ensure therapeutic dosing.
example_usage: Digoxin level is 1.2 ng/mL therapeutic range.

definition: Measures blood level of vancomycin antibiotic to guide dosing.
example_usage: Vancomycin trough is 18 mcg/mL.

definition: Measures blood level of anti-seizure medication phenytoin.
example_usage: Phenytoin level subtherapeutic at 6 mcg/mL.

definition: Measures blood level of theophylline bronchodilator medication.
example_usage: Theophylline level is 12 mcg/mL within range.

definition: A screening test for human immunodeficiency virus.
example_usage: Fourth generation HIV test is preferred.

definition: Tests for hepatitis A B and C viruses.
example_usage: Hepatitis panel ordered for jaundiced patient.

definition: A marker of active hepatitis B infection.
example_usage: Positive HBsAg indicates current HBV infection.

definition: Indicates immunity to hepatitis B from vaccine or past infection.
example_usage: Positive anti-HBs shows HBV immunity.

definition: Screening test for hepatitis C virus.
example_usage: Positive HCV antibody requires RNA confirmation.

definition: A screening test for syphilis.
example_usage: Positive RPR confirmed with FTA-ABS.

definition: A rapid test for Epstein-Barr virus causing infectious mononucleosis.
example_usage: Mono test positive with atypical lymphocytes.

definition: A rapid antigen test for Group A Streptococcus causing strep throat.
example_usage: Rapid strep test positive treat with antibiotics.

definition: A rapid test detecting influenza A and B viruses.
example_usage: Flu test positive for influenza A.

definition: A test detecting SARS-CoV-2 virus causing COVID-19.
example_usage: PCR COVID test is most accurate.

definition: An autoimmune marker elevated in lupus and other connective tissue diseases.
example_usage: Positive ANA with speckled pattern.

definition: An autoantibody elevated in rheumatoid arthritis.
example_usage: Positive RF supports RA diagnosis.

definition: A specific antibody for rheumatoid arthritis.
example_usage: Anti-CCP is more specific than RF for RA.

definition: A protein part of immune system low in active lupus.
example_usage: Low C3 indicates lupus flare.

definition: A protein part of immune system low in active lupus.
example_usage: Low C4 with low C3 in lupus nephritis.

definition: A screening test for hidden blood in stool indicating GI bleeding or cancer.
example_usage: Positive FOBT requires colonoscopy.

definition: A test identifying bacteria causing diarrhea.
example_usage: Stool culture positive for Salmonella.

definition: A test detecting toxin from C. diff bacteria causing severe diarrhea.
example_usage: C. diff toxin positive start vancomycin.

definition: A test for bacteria that causes stomach ulcers.
example_usage: Positive H. pylori treat with triple therapy.

definition: A urine or blood test detecting hCG to confirm pregnancy.
example_usage: Urine pregnancy test positive.

definition: A cervical cancer screening test examining cervical cells.
example_usage: Pap smear shows ASCUS repeat in 1 year.

definition: A test evaluating sperm count motility and morphology for fertility.
example_usage: Semen analysis shows oligospermia.
